00037 #ifndef __LNET_TYPES_H__
00038 #define __LNET_TYPES_H__

00043 #include <linux/types.h>
00047 #define LNET_VERSION            "0.7.0"
00048 
00052 #define LNET_RESERVED_PORTAL      0
00053 
00064 typedef __u64 lnet_nid_t;
00069 typedef __u32 lnet_pid_t;
00070 
00072 #define LNET_NID_ANY      ((lnet_nid_t) -1)
00073 
00074 #define LNET_PID_ANY      ((lnet_pid_t) -1)
00075 
00076 #define LNET_PID_RESERVED 0xf0000000 /* reserved bits in PID */
00077 #define LNET_PID_USERFLAG 0x80000000 /* set in userspace peers */
00078 #define LNET_PID_LUSTRE 12345
00079 
00080 #define LNET_TIME_FOREVER    (-1)
00081 
00082 /* how an LNET NID encodes net:address */
00085 static inline __u32 LNET_NIDADDR(lnet_nid_t nid)
00086 {
00087         return nid & 0xffffffff;
00088 }
00089 
00090 static inline __u32 LNET_NIDNET(lnet_nid_t nid)
00091 {
00092         return (nid >> 32) & 0xffffffff;
00093 }
00094 
00095 static inline lnet_nid_t LNET_MKNID(__u32 net, __u32 addr)
00096 {
00097         return (((__u64)net) << 32) | addr;
00098 }
00099 
00100 static inline __u32 LNET_NETNUM(__u32 net)
00101 {
00102         return net & 0xffff;
00103 }
00104 
00105 static inline __u32 LNET_NETTYP(__u32 net)
00106 {
00107         return (net >> 16) & 0xffff;
00108 }
00109 
00110 static inline __u32 LNET_MKNET(__u32 type, __u32 num)
00111 {
00112         return (type << 16) | num;
00113 }
00114 
00115 #define WIRE_ATTR       __attribute__((packed))
00116 
00117 /* Packed version of lnet_process_id_t to transfer via network */
00118 typedef struct {
00119         lnet_nid_t nid;
00120         lnet_pid_t pid; /* node id / process id */
00121 } WIRE_ATTR lnet_process_id_packed_t;
00122 
00123 /* The wire handle's interface cookie only matches one network interface in
00124  * one epoch (i.e. new cookie when the interface restarts or the node
00125  * reboots).  The object cookie only matches one object on that interface
00126  * during that object's lifetime (i.e. no cookie re-use). */
00127 typedef struct {
00128         __u64 wh_interface_cookie;
00129         __u64 wh_object_cookie;
00130 } WIRE_ATTR lnet_handle_wire_t;
00131 
00132 typedef enum {
00133         LNET_MSG_ACK = 0,
00134         LNET_MSG_PUT,
00135         LNET_MSG_GET,
00136         LNET_MSG_REPLY,
00137         LNET_MSG_HELLO,
00138 } lnet_msg_type_t;
00139 
00140 /* The variant fields of the portals message header are aligned on an 8
00141  * byte boundary in the message header.  Note that all types used in these
00142  * wire structs MUST be fixed size and the smaller types are placed at the
00143  * end. */
00144 typedef struct lnet_ack {
00145         lnet_handle_wire_t      dst_wmd;
00146         __u64                   match_bits;
00147         __u32                   mlength;
00148 } WIRE_ATTR lnet_ack_t;
00149 
00150 typedef struct lnet_put {
00151         lnet_handle_wire_t      ack_wmd;
00152         __u64                   match_bits;
00153         __u64                   hdr_data;
00154         __u32                   ptl_index;
00155         __u32                   offset;
00156 } WIRE_ATTR lnet_put_t;
00157 
00158 typedef struct lnet_get {
00159         lnet_handle_wire_t      return_wmd;
00160         __u64                   match_bits;
00161         __u32                   ptl_index;
00162         __u32                   src_offset;
00163         __u32                   sink_length;
00164 } WIRE_ATTR lnet_get_t;
00165 
00166 typedef struct lnet_reply {
00167         lnet_handle_wire_t      dst_wmd;
00168 } WIRE_ATTR lnet_reply_t;
00169 
00170 typedef struct lnet_hello {
00171         __u64                   incarnation;
00172         __u32                   type;
00173 } WIRE_ATTR lnet_hello_t;
00174 
00175 typedef struct {
00176         lnet_nid_t      dest_nid;
00177         lnet_nid_t      src_nid;
00178         lnet_pid_t      dest_pid;
00179         lnet_pid_t      src_pid;
00180         __u32           type;           /* lnet_msg_type_t */
00181         __u32           payload_length; /* payload data to follow */
00182         /*<------__u64 aligned------->*/
00183         union {
00184                 lnet_ack_t      ack;
00185                 lnet_put_t      put;
00186                 lnet_get_t      get;
00187                 lnet_reply_t    reply;
00188                 lnet_hello_t    hello;
00189         } msg;
00190 } WIRE_ATTR lnet_hdr_t;
00191 
00192 /* A HELLO message contains a magic number and protocol version
00193  * code in the header's dest_nid, the peer's NID in the src_nid, and
00194  * LNET_MSG_HELLO in the type field.  All other common fields are zero
00195  * (including payload_size; i.e. no payload).
00196  * This is for use by byte-stream LNDs (e.g. TCP/IP) to check the peer is
00197  * running the same protocol and to find out its NID. These LNDs should
00198  * exchange HELLO messages when a connection is first established.  Individual
00199  * LNDs can put whatever else they fancy in lnet_hdr_t::msg.
00200  */
00201 typedef struct {
00202         __u32   magic;          /* LNET_PROTO_TCP_MAGIC */
00203         __u16   version_major;  /* increment on incompatible change */
00204         __u16   version_minor;  /* increment on compatible change */
00205 } WIRE_ATTR lnet_magicversion_t;
00206 
00207 /* PROTO MAGIC for LNDs */
00208 #define LNET_PROTO_IB_MAGIC             0x0be91b91
00209 #define LNET_PROTO_GNI_MAGIC            0xb00fbabe /* ask Kim */
00210 #define LNET_PROTO_TCP_MAGIC            0xeebc0ded
00211 #define LNET_PROTO_ACCEPTOR_MAGIC       0xacce7100
00212 #define LNET_PROTO_PING_MAGIC           0x70696E67 /* 'ping' */
00213 
00214 /* Placeholder for a future "unified" protocol across all LNDs */
00215 /* Current LNDs that receive a request with this magic will respond
00216  * with a "stub" reply using their current protocol */
00217 #define LNET_PROTO_MAGIC                0x45726963 /* ! */
00218 
00219 #define LNET_PROTO_TCP_VERSION_MAJOR    1
00220 #define LNET_PROTO_TCP_VERSION_MINOR    0
00221 
00222 /* Acceptor connection request */
00223 typedef struct {
00224         __u32   acr_magic;      /* PTL_ACCEPTOR_PROTO_MAGIC */
00225         __u32   acr_version;    /* protocol version */
00226         __u64   acr_nid;        /* target NID */
00227 } WIRE_ATTR lnet_acceptor_connreq_t;
00228 
00229 #define LNET_PROTO_ACCEPTOR_VERSION     1
00230 
00231 typedef struct lnet_counters {
00232         __u32   msgs_alloc;
00233         __u32   msgs_max;
00234         __u32   errors;
00235         __u32   send_count;
00236         __u32   recv_count;
00237         __u32   route_count;
00238         __u32   drop_count;
00239         __u64   send_length;
00240         __u64   recv_length;
00241         __u64   route_length;
00242         __u64   drop_length;
00243 } WIRE_ATTR lnet_counters_t;
00244 
00245 #define LNET_NI_STATUS_UP       0x15aac0de
00246 #define LNET_NI_STATUS_DOWN     0xdeadface
00247 #define LNET_NI_STATUS_INVALID  0x00000000
00248 
00249 #define LNET_MAX_INTERFACES     16

00261 typedef struct {
00262         __u64         cookie;
00263 } lnet_handle_any_t;
00264 
00265 typedef lnet_handle_any_t lnet_handle_eq_t;
00266 typedef lnet_handle_any_t lnet_handle_md_t;
00267 typedef lnet_handle_any_t lnet_handle_me_t;
00268 
00269 #define LNET_WIRE_HANDLE_COOKIE_NONE   (-1)
00270 
00274 static inline void LNetInvalidateHandle(lnet_handle_any_t *h)
00275 {
00276         h->cookie = LNET_WIRE_HANDLE_COOKIE_NONE;
00277 }
00278 
00284 static inline int LNetHandleIsEqual (lnet_handle_any_t h1, lnet_handle_any_t h2)
00285 {
00286         return (h1.cookie == h2.cookie);
00287 }
00288 
00294 static inline int LNetHandleIsInvalid(lnet_handle_any_t h)
00295 {
00296         return (LNET_WIRE_HANDLE_COOKIE_NONE == h.cookie);
00297 }

00306         lnet_pid_t pid;

00347 typedef struct {
00369         void            *start;
00370         unsigned int     length;
00381         int              threshold;
00389         int              max_size;
00426         unsigned int     options;
00433         void            *user_ptr;
00440         lnet_handle_eq_t eq_handle;
00441 } lnet_md_t;
00442 
00443 /* Max Transfer Unit (minimum supported everywhere).
00444  * CAVEAT EMPTOR, with multinet (i.e. routers forwarding between networks)
00445  * these limits are system wide and not interface-local. */
00446 #define LNET_MTU_BITS   20
00447 #define LNET_MTU        (1 << LNET_MTU_BITS)
00448 
00450 #define LNET_MAX_IOV    256
00451 
00455 #define LNET_MD_OP_PUT               (1 << 0)
00456 
00457 #define LNET_MD_OP_GET               (1 << 1)
00458 
00459 #define LNET_MD_MANAGE_REMOTE        (1 << 2)
00460 /* unused                            (1 << 3) */
00462 #define LNET_MD_TRUNCATE             (1 << 4)
00463 
00464 #define LNET_MD_ACK_DISABLE          (1 << 5)
00465 
00466 #define LNET_MD_IOVEC                (1 << 6)
00467 
00468 #define LNET_MD_MAX_SIZE             (1 << 7)
00469 
00470 #define LNET_MD_KIOV                 (1 << 8)
00471 
00472 /* For compatibility with Cray Portals */
00473 #define LNET_MD_PHYS                         0
00474 
00476 #define LNET_MD_THRESH_INF       (-1)

00495 } lnet_kiov_t;
00504 typedef enum {
00506         LNET_EVENT_GET          = 1,
00512         LNET_EVENT_PUT,
00517         LNET_EVENT_REPLY,
00519         LNET_EVENT_ACK,

00539         LNET_EVENT_UNLINK,
00540 } lnet_event_kind_t;

00542 #define LNET_SEQ_BASETYPE       long
00543 typedef unsigned LNET_SEQ_BASETYPE lnet_seq_t;
00544 #define LNET_SEQ_GT(a,b)        (((signed LNET_SEQ_BASETYPE)((a) - (b))) > 0)
00545 
00549 typedef struct {
00551         lnet_process_id_t   target;
00553         lnet_process_id_t   initiator;
00559         lnet_nid_t          sender;
00561         lnet_event_kind_t   type;
00563         unsigned int        pt_index;
00565         __u64               match_bits;
00567         unsigned int        rlength;
00575         unsigned int        mlength;
00580         lnet_handle_md_t    md_handle;
00586         lnet_md_t           md;
00591         __u64               hdr_data;
00596         int                 status;
00603         int                 unlinked;
00610         unsigned int        offset;
00615         volatile lnet_seq_t sequence;
00616 } lnet_event_t;
